title: New CEO or Air India: A tough nut to crack
text:
New CEO or Air India: A tough nut to crack   
By Anil Mathur, eTN India | Sep 12, 2015 eTN   
Ashwani Lohani, who recently took over as Chairman and Managing Director of Air India admitted today that it was a 'tough nut to crack'. He obviously refered to many problems and issues faced by the once-grand and Maharaja airline, and pride of India. 
Lohani told a welcome meet organised by the Indian Association of Tour Operators that it was a challenge and he required all the good wishes to bring back the sheen in the airline. 
The former head of Madhya Pradesh Tourism, who spent time in Tourism Ministry and is a Railway Mechanical engineer, is known for delivering goods and is effective in implementation. 
He said that the basics of Air India were sound and he hoped to turn around the ailing Star Alliance carrier. 
Vinod Zutshi, the new Secretary in the Ministry of Tourism lauded the role of IATO in tourism promotion. 
He said that what was required was a coordinated, integrated approach and involving all the stakeholders. He would try to do this, he assured. The top tourism bureaucrat revealed that a new National Tourism Policy will be announced soon. 
The IATO said farewell to the senior officials who left the ministry and welcomed the new ones who joined it.
